content.statement: aku-032-schwarzschild-radius-definition is a fundamental concept in Natural-Sciences Physics Quantum-Mechanics Planck-Units that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding aku-032-schwarzschild-radius-definition helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of aku-032-schwarzschild-radius-definition include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of aku-032-schwarzschild-radius-definition.

definitions_glossary.schwarzschild_radius: Radius r_s = 2GM/c² of the event horizon of a non-rotating black hole
definitions_glossary.event_horizon: Boundary at r = r_s inside which escape to infinity is impossible
definitions_glossary.schwarzschild_geometry: Spherically symmetric solution to Einstein's equations for vacuum spacetime around mass M
definitions_glossary.escape_velocity: Minimum velocity v_esc = √(2GM/r) needed to escape to infinity from radius r
definitions_glossary.coordinate_singularity: Apparent singularity in coordinates that can be removed by coordinate transformation
definitions_glossary.physical_singularity: True curvature singularity at r=0 where spacetime curvature diverges

from_escape_velocity.step_1: Escape velocity from Newtonian gravity: v_esc = √(2GM/r)
from_escape_velocity.step_2: Set escape velocity equal to speed of light: v_esc = c
from_escape_velocity.note: Surprisingly, this Newtonian derivation gives the correct GR result!

from_schwarzschild_metric.interpretation: At r = r_s, radial coordinate becomes timelike and time coordinate becomes spacelike

from_light_cone_tipping.far_from_mass: Light cones are vertical in spacetime diagram
from_light_cone_tipping.approaching_horizon: Light cones tip inward due to spacetime curvature
from_light_cone_tipping.at_horizon: Outgoing light cone is exactly vertical (light 'stands still')
from_light_cone_tipping.inside_horizon: All light cones tip inward - all paths lead to r=0
from_light_cone_tipping.conclusion: Event horizon at r_s is where escape becomes impossible

dimensional_analysis.fundamental_constants: Depends on G (gravity strength) and c (spacetime structure)

solar_mass_black_hole.interpretation: Sun compressed to 3 km radius would become black hole
solar_mass_black_hole.comparison: Actual Sun radius ~696,000 km - must compress by factor of 235,000

earth_mass_black_hole.interpretation: Earth compressed to size of marble would become black hole
earth_mass_black_hole.comparison: Actual Earth radius ~6,371 km - must compress by factor of 7 × 10⁸

supermassive_black_hole.observation: Event Horizon Telescope imaged shadow at ~20 GM/c² ≈ 10r_s

planck_mass_schwarzschild_radius.interpretation: At Planck mass, Schwarzschild radius equals Compton wavelength - quantum gravity regime

stellar_mass_black_hole.examples: Cygnus X-1 (15 M☉), GW150914 components (36, 29 M☉)

scale_comparisons.comparison: Smaller than Planck length - quantum effects dominate
Shadow size ~10r_s due to light bending

in_black_hole_physics.event_horizon: r_s defines the point of no return for infalling matter and light
in_black_hole_physics.hawking_radiation: Black holes emit thermal radiation with temperature ∝ 1/r_s
in_black_hole_physics.entropy: S_BH = k_B c³/(4ℏG) A = k_B πr_s²c³/(ℏG) ∝ r_s²

in_general_relativity.first_exact_solution: Schwarzschild (1916) found first exact solution to Einstein equations
in_general_relativity.singularity_theorems: Penrose-Hawking theorems predict singularity inside r_s
in_general_relativity.geodesics: At r < r_s, all timelike geodesics lead to r=0
in_general_relativity.frame_dragging: Rotating black holes (Kerr) have different horizon structure

in_quantum_gravity.criterion: When r_s ~ λ_C, quantum and gravitational effects equally important
in_quantum_gravity.below_planck_mass: For M < m_P: λ_C > r_s (quantum dominates)
in_quantum_gravity.above_planck_mass: For M > m_P: r_s > λ_C (gravity dominates, black hole forms)
in_quantum_gravity.quantum_corrections: For r ~ r_s ~ ℓ_P, quantum gravity essential

in_astrophysics.stellar_collapse: Stars with M > 20M☉ collapse to black holes with r ~ r_s
in_astrophysics.accretion_disks: Matter spirals inward until r ~ 3r_s (innermost stable orbit)
in_astrophysics.gravitational_waves: Binary black hole mergers measured by LIGO/Virgo
in_astrophysics.event_horizon_telescope: First image of M87* black hole shadow (2019)

schwarzschild_metric.horizon: At r = r_s: g_tt → 0, g_rr → ∞ (coordinate singularity)
schwarzschild_metric.interior: For r < r_s: t and r roles swap (r becomes timelike)

eddington_finkelstein_coordinates.advantage: No coordinate singularity at r = r_s
eddington_finkelstein_coordinates.interpretation: Smooth crossing of event horizon possible

kruskal_szekeres_coordinates.advantage: Maximal analytic extension of Schwarzschild spacetime
kruskal_szekeres_coordinates.reveals: White hole, black hole, two asymptotic regions
kruskal_szekeres_coordinates.causal_structure: Clear light cone structure across all regions

discovery_timeline.achievement: Found exact solution to Einstein's field equations
discovery_timeline.context: Within months of Einstein publishing general relativity
discovery_timeline.note: Schwarzschild derived solution while serving in WWI

discovery_timeline.achievement: Showed stellar collapse leads to black hole formation
discovery_timeline.significance: First realistic black hole formation mechanism

discovery_timeline.achievement: Showed event horizon is coordinate effect, not physical singularity

discovery_timeline.significance: Proved singularity inside event horizon under general conditions

discovery_timeline.achievement: Black holes emit radiation with T ∝ 1/r_s

discovery_timeline.discovery: LIGO detects gravitational waves from black hole merger

discovery_timeline.achievement: Event Horizon Telescope images M87* shadow
discovery_timeline.significance: First direct image of event horizon

direct_observations.eht_imaging: Black hole shadow has diameter ~10r_s due to photon ring
direct_observations.x_ray_reflection: Accretion disk iron line broadening probes r ~ r_s
direct_observations.star_orbits: S-stars orbit Sgr A* allow measurement of M and r_s

indirect_evidence.compact_object: Object with M but radius < r_s must be black hole
indirect_evidence.no_surface_emission: Absence of Type I X-ray bursts suggests event horizon
indirect_evidence.isco: Innermost stable circular orbit at r = 3r_s (non-rotating BH)
indirect_evidence.jet_formation: Relativistic jets often originate near r ~ r_s

definition.@value: The radius r_s = 2GM/c² of the event horizon of a non-rotating, uncharged black hole, representing the boundary inside which escape velocity exceeds the speed of light

learning_objectives: Calculate r_s for various masses (Earth, Sun, stellar, supermassive)
Explain physical significance as event horizon
Understand connection to Compton wavelength at Planck mass
Appreciate historical development from 1916 to present
common_mistakes: Thinking event horizon is a physical surface (it's a boundary in spacetime)
Confusing Schwarzschild radius with physical singularity (singularity is at r=0)
Believing you can't cross event horizon (you can, but can't return)
Using Schwarzschild radius for rotating black holes (need Kerr solution)

emphasis: connection to quantum gravity at Planck mass
visualization_suggestions: Diagram: Event horizon at r_s with infalling matter
Comparison table: r_s for various objects (Earth to supermassive BH)
Spacetime diagram: Light cones tipping at r_s
Image: EHT image of M87* with r_s scale indicated
